unnormalised: ## Oh No, Did My Shopping Cart Run Away to Goa? (A Retail Confession)
normalised: ## Oh No, Did My Shopping Cart Run Away to Goa? (A Retail Confession)

unnormalised: We've all been there, haven't we? You're browsing your favourite e-commerce site, maybe Myntra or Ajio, eyes glued to that perfect Anarkali suit for Diwali, or perhaps a swanky new pair of sneakers to impress Sharmaji's daughter at the next society get-together. You add it to your cart, feeling that sweet, sweet rush of retail therapy, ready to click 'checkout' and BAM! Distraction strikes.

unnormalised: Maybe Amma calls you down for chai and pakoras. Maybe your boss decides to hold an impromptu Zoom meeting to discuss "synergies" (whatever those are!). Whatever it is, you wander away, and your carefully curated shopping cart, like a stubborn rickshaw driver refusing to go the full distance, is… abandoned.

unnormalised: According to stats, a whopping 70% of online shopping carts are abandoned. 70 PERCENT! That’s more than the number of students who actually attended my Engineering Mechanics class at IIT-Bombay (no offense to the professor, but differential equations after a late-night chai run? No thank you!).

unnormalised: But why does this happen? Is it the unexpected Rs. 50 delivery charge suddenly making that gorgeous Sabyasachi-inspired lehenga seem a tad less… essential? Maybe. Or perhaps you suddenly remembered you have a cousin’s wedding next month and that budget you painstakingly created is already screaming in protest.

unnormalised: Whatever the reason, cart abandonment is the Everest of e-commerce challenges. We retailers are constantly trying to figure out how to get you back to that abandoned cart, dangling enticing offers like free shipping or a cheeky 10% discount. We’re practically begging you to complete that purchase!

unnormalised: So, next time you find yourself with a runaway shopping cart, ask yourself: is it truly gone for good? Or is there a little corner of your heart (and your wallet) that still whispers, “Click checkout, beta. Click checkout.” Because trust me, we’re waiting. And we might even throw in a complimentary packet of Haldiram's Bhujia. Just saying.
